meanings.definition: A person who crowns or awards a prize.
meanings.sent1: The crowners presented the trophy to the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent2: The crowners at the ceremony handed out medals to the top athletes.
meanings.sent3: The crowners made sure to give the shiny trophy to the fastest runner.
meanings.sent4: The crowners bestowed the golden crown upon the champion of the race.
meanings.sent5: The crowners' job is to honor the best performer with a special award.

meanings.definition: A tool used for removing crowns from teeth.
meanings.sent1: The dentist used the crowners to carefully take off the old crown from the tooth.
meanings.sent2: Dental assistants rely on crowners to assist in dental procedures.
meanings.sent3: The crowners helped the dentist in fixing the broken tooth.
meanings.sent4: The crowners delicately removed the damaged crown from the patient's tooth.
meanings.sent5: The crowners are essential tools in dental care for fixing teeth.

meanings.definition: The final or decisive event in a series.
meanings.sent1: The championship game was the crowners of the entire season.
meanings.sent2: The last match of the tournament served as the crowners of the competition.
meanings.sent3: The crowners of the game determined the ultimate winner of the league.
meanings.sent4: The crowners of the race decided the overall champion of the event.
meanings.sent5: The crowners of the event marked the thrilling conclusion of the series.
